attributes.action: Require Train Companies to refund and/or exchange advance-purchase train tickets
attributes.background: Trains do not refund or even at least exchange advance purchase tickets. There is no economic value to society or benefit to the customer for this. If people's plans change, or they mistakenly book the wrong date, they should be allowed to refund it within a certain timeframe.
attributes.additional_details: You can't get a refund on an advance purchase ticket months in advance, unless you exchange it for another advance purchase ticket at the cost of £10. This is not fair for consumers. This is simply companies trying to squeeze out every penny they can from the consumer. Megabus charge £1 to change your tickets, but trains charge £10, and if you're train ticket is around £10 - £30 anyway, on balance it's cheaper buying a new one. This would also help trains stop overreserving seats in carriages too.

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Make tax incentives and laws for companies allowing people to work  from home.
attributes.background: Because a lot of people travel into work in cities we are overloading the traffic infrastructure, creating pollution. parking problems and destroying country villages. Give companies incentives to allow them to support home workers, remove laws making companies for being responsible for home areas.
attributes.additional_details: companies are made responsible for the environment that people are working in at home, allow workers to opt out of this protection so they can work at home. Companies should only be responsible for the computers and equipment they supply nothing else. this will allow people with children to work from home. also companies can use more part time workers.

attributes.action: Change the way fines i.e. Speeding/Drunk and Disorderly are calculated.
attributes.background: Instead of a fixed price fine we should have a proportional fine so it affects each person the same way, it should be 10% of the offending persons average weekly wage (10% of 1/52th, 1 weeks worth, of last year's net pay) or a minimum of £80, whichever is the greater.
attributes.additional_details:
This way it have much more of an equal affect upon the culprit and even out some balance of a unfair prosecution system which effects the poorest more.

For example in October this year (2017) a professional footballer was caught speeding and was fined £440, alot of money for a person on minimum wage but does not have the same impact on someone reportedly earning £37,500 per week. This may be an extreme example however I feel this change allow punishment to be felt equally across the board.

attributes.action: Pass legislation for the use of indelible ink pens mandatory for ALL elections.
attributes.background: In an age where pens are as cost effective as pencils, there is no excuse why the use of indelible ink pens should not be made mandatory. Old arguments on cost and potential for ink to smudge are not relevant today. However, a perception votes cast using a pencil can be manipulated, is a concern.

attributes.action: Increase the funding for additional support for prison officers well-being.
attributes.background:
Prison officers are in a highly demanding and challenging job that requires readily available support systems in terms of both their mental health and well-being. 
We are petitioning for:
More counselling with independent professional counsellors to deal with mental health in the work place.
attributes.additional_details:
7159 assaults on prison officers and serious assaults on prison officers has trebled from previous year (MOJ, 2017); impacting their psychological and physical safety at work, overall effecting the prison system in whole.
We think this intervention would be beneficial for prison officers, prisoners and society as a whole.

attributes.action: Move pedestrian crossing buttons further away from roadside for safety.
attributes.background: I believe that the position of 'Crossing Buttons' is too near the road. Children often run towards the button, wanting to be the one that presses it. A trip or stumble could easily result in them falling into the road or cause a motorist to swerve/brake etc. Bringing risk of accident or fatality.

attributes.action: Call for all people who mentally cause suicide to be prosecuted for MURDER
attributes.background:
This petition calls for 'murder' to be redefined so that if it can be proven that one person has committed suicide as a result of another person's/ other people's actions, a murder charge can result.
The punishment will be a starting point of a minimum of 15 years in prison (12 years for under 18s)
attributes.additional_details:
Too many people are killing themselves due to other people's evil actions. There is currently no crime that has been committed.
Manslaughter is 'the crime of killing a human being without malice aforethought'. That basically means that if you physically kill somebody without intent or the mental capacity to understand your actions.
To force a person to suicide, a person must have such great intent to harm others. There is malice! Murder could be 'killing a human deliberately or due to bullying'

attributes.action: Government needs to require harassment training for late night venue licenses
attributes.background: By training staff once a year, venues can ensure that staff know what to do and who to report to, ensuring women feel safe.This can be provided by existing trainers, and has been piloted in Southwark council. Training costs, which are low, could be covered by the venues.
attributes.additional_details: I work with women who experience abuse and see an increase in abuse to women especially in late night venues. Government needs to address the rising levels of sexual harassment that women experience in late night bars and clubs, by changing licensing laws to require landlords and venue owners to train staff on how to respond to sexual harassment complaints effectively.  A change in the law will ensure a clear message to those who harass others, and to those who just want the harassment to stop.

attributes.action: Allow on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights.
attributes.background: Allowing on call and volunteer emergency personnel to use green flashing lights would make them more noticeable to other vehicles. This would help minimise delays while they are trying to get to their respective station. Delays cost lives!
attributes.additional_details: Green flashing lights can currently be used by doctors. These lights don't give any exemption to traffic laws, but do highlight the importance of the journey. This means that vehicles are more likely to let them past than if they had no lighting.

attributes.action: Free Prescriptions for all under 25s in full time education
attributes.background: It is currently free for full time students aged 18 and under to get prescription medication. I’ve just turned 19 and will now have to pay for my medication whilst being a full time university student, so it may become that I cannot afford it every month and forfeit my health due to financial issues
attributes.additional_details: Many students may not see their gp due to this. I think that a valid student ID should give exemption to paying for prescriptions when being a first time student. The age limit needs raising from 18 to 25 to account for this.

attributes.action: Provide nationwide equal access to suitable wheelchairs to all who need one.
attributes.background: Wheelchair provision for people with disabilities is currently the responsibility of local NHS services. Eligibility criteria vary by postcode meaning unequal access. Criteria and equipment provided are often unsuitable, meaning many are left housebound and unable to live independently.
attributes.additional_details:
People with disabilities have unequal access to wheelchairs depending on where they live. We ask the government to standardise eligibility criteria and provision across the nation to ensure equal access.

Power chairs are not provided for use outside the home. This means people who can walk only in the home but cannot self-propel are not provided a chair at all, so remain housebound.

We ask the government to provide a suitable wheelchair to each person who needs one to live an independent life.

attributes.action: Amend the Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: This was first suggested in July 2016 following a mixed breed Staffie mixed type dog nearly killing my Border Terrier. Only 66 people at that time signed it, so this time round it should get a better result.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the high number of dog attacks on sheep, and people as well as other canines, the aim is to have all dog owners and dog homes must have every dog’s DNA taken and registered on a database with their microchip. This would allow all dogs to be screened when attacks happen to find the owners.  Wounds can be swabbed and detection made, not only during injury investigation or th of sheep, but also for banned breeds!  
The DNA could also assist District Council to check samples of uncollected poo in order to trace owners and prosecute them.

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: Rule out involving our NHS in a trade deal with the US
attributes.background: Theresa May has refused to rule out trading away our NHS in a deal with the USA. We want to show that that is not the will of the people.

attributes.action: Change the criteria for PIP assessments
attributes.background: Many disabled have been taken off their benefits despite no improvement to their condition. The PIP criteria does not adequately assess the effects of disability and is far too severe. It should be changed under the advice of doctors and disabled people.
attributes.additional_details: To qualify for the disability part of working tax credits you must receive PIP, but nowhere in PIP is your ability to work assessed. The PIP assessment is unconcerned with your quality of life and tries to fit disabled people into narrow tick boxes which often aren’t appropriate. Many feel that the PIP assessment is poorly suited to its purpose. The general public, disabled in particular, should be consulted and in partnership with doctors, a new system drawn up.

attributes.action: Buy British made Mechanised Infantry Vehicles for the army
attributes.background: Britain currently has a major trade deficit, especially in manufactured goods. the country's engineering capability and capacity has been severely degraded over the past thirty years, in part because of successive refusals by the British government to support and encourage manufacturing in Britain.

attributes.action: national insurance to be used solely to fund the NHS
attributes.background: National insurance payments to be used solely to fund the NHS and social care budget for the elderly . as suggested by various forward thinking politicians and not be used as another stealth tax

attributes.action: Introduce owner-funded dog DNA register so that Councils can fine owners easier.
attributes.background: Dog fouling is the blight of Britain.Whilst Councils have powers to enforce legislation most don't have the manpower to do this away from town centres. A DNA register would allow a much more efficient prosecution process. People have the right to walk without looking at their feet.
attributes.additional_details: DNA registration is relatively cheap, and economies of scale with a national database would reduce the costs further. This cost would be the responsibility of the owner, and a legal requirement to have a dog DNA registered. Due to the amount of dog fouling, especially on open public spaces away from Wardens/Police, there is very little chance of anyone being fined for letting their dog foul, or picking it up but throwing their dog bag into the hedge.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Provide financial help for victims of domestic violence
attributes.background:
Give them the freedom to escape their situation without having to worry about the financial repercussions. Even if they own their own homes there should be support since often they would have been financially dependent on their abuser.
Freedom to escape without facing potential homelessness
attributes.additional_details: There is no financial help for people with a mortgage, even if they cant afford to pay the mortgage, have no job and no income. Temporary help would give people that safety net they need to have the courage to leave an abusive relationship without having to worry about becoming homeless. The housing register rejects applicants based on a tick box saying yes i have a mortgaged property - it takes months to sell a house and everyone deserves to have a safe home to live in.

attributes.action: The UK stays in the customs union as part of the Brexit process.
attributes.background: The UK is a trading nation and free movement of our goods within the EU is critical. Being a member does not prevent the UK from trading with other countries - we do so now. It simply means that tariffs have to be paid in certain circumstances. It would also solve the Ireland impasse at stroke.
attributes.additional_details: Most MPs support the customs union being retained but Brexiteers want it removed in order to enable this country to negotiate trade deals with other countries. Not having a trade deal does not prevent members of the union from trading with other countries. Germany for example trades a great deal with China as we do with the USA. Tariffs have to be paid in some circumstances but that does not stop trading.

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: Amend the National Lottery licence to specify the Operator should be a Charity.
attributes.background:
The UK National Lottery operator Camelot is a profit making Ltd Company which pays large dividends to Shareholders. It is NOT a registered Charity with the Charity Commission.
A requirement of the Licence should be that the operator be a registered not-for-profit Charity. The Government must act.
attributes.additional_details:
Camelot is NOT a Charity and is NOT registered with the Charity Commission. It should be a not-for-profit organisation.
Camelot's majority shareholder is a Parent Company called Premier Lotteries UK Ltd, which in turn is majority owned by a Canadian Teachers Pension Fund, specifically Ontario.
The last 2 year's dividends paid to this Canadian Pension fund (via Premier Lotteries UK Ltd) were £66.6m in 2017 and £84.2m in 2016. These are funds which could be utilised within the UK on good causes.

attributes.action: Establish an independent board that investigates complaints against the Police
attributes.background: After our own personal experiences of accessing the Police Complaints System we soon realised it is not fit for purpose.  We  represent a large number of victims  and all of those who have made a complaint to the Police have either not had their complaint investigated or had a satisfactory outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Presently the Police investigate themselves and this is obvious it is open to misconduct.  We and our victims we represent have complained to the IPCC on numerous occasions and they will not investigate the Police often sending the complaint straight back to the Professional Standards Department.  We want a Police Complaints system totally independent to the Police made up of members trained in Law and with civilian oversight and a number of victims of crime on the panel.

attributes.action: Increase the Penalty for NOT STOPPING after an Accident on the Highway by Driver
attributes.background: There are far too many Drivers these days who HIT and RUN, at this time the Penalty is far too Low and needs a Large increase, many are Killed and it is Gutless Not to stop, I know some of these may have a reason like No Insurance or wanted by the Police, they are Cowards when the persons are dying
attributes.additional_details:
In the Media there are cases every week now, this needs Controlling with adverts detailing the Penalty increase, it is a shame where things are going these days making life Cheap.

Let’s try and get things Changed.

attributes.action: Cut the overseas budget
attributes.background: The Prime Minster Should and must cut the overseas budget by 75% and spend the money on rectifying our countries finacial parlous position, and stop the ever continuing cuts.

attributes.action: Provide a 9-1 GCSE Law syllabus and encourage examination boards to follow it.
attributes.background: GCSE law is a great qualification as it allows students who do not have the knowledge to perform at a-level to show their ability in another way. Sadly, all the exam boards that provide the subject will scrap it in 2018. This petition calls on the government to provide a syllabus after that.
attributes.additional_details:
"GCSE Law helps students to develop skills of selection, analysis, critical thinking and decision making, and builds an awareness of the rights and responsibilities of individuals" AQA
Without this subject, we risk causing a lack of knowledge around students who no longer have any reason to study law at 16. All the exam boards... Namely OCR and AQA plan to abolish the subject! http://www.aqa.org.uk/subjects/law/gcse/law-4160
http://www.ocr.org.uk/qualifications/gcse-law-j485-from-2012/

attributes.action: Make voting in local & general elections compulsory.
attributes.background: The 'turn-out' at local government elections is abysmal. The resultant problem is that small groups that are motivated by a covert agenda may succeed. A 'fixed penalty' for failing to vote - as applies in Australia & N.Z. - might provide an extra incentive to vote.
attributes.additional_details: District & County Councillors, School Governors, are being elected by a tiny number of electors. Called upon to administer complex issues & substantial budgets, they may be - at best - incompetent, at worst be driven by a motive contrary to that desired by the majority. The ballot slip should include a box labelled 'none of the above', but anyone on the electoral roll who doesn't vote should have to pay a fixed penalty - say £50. Voting 'on line' should also be possible.

attributes.action: Require labelling of all products which contain pig or its bye products
attributes.background: Lot of products edible or for human use are in the market which contain pig and its bye products without specifying. Jellies, soaps, breads and spreads etc. can contain lard or pig bones without specifying. This hurts lots of people’s sentiments and beliefs.

attributes.action: Make government condemn the violence of Spain's police against the Catalans
attributes.background: On the day of the Catalonia independence referendum, Spain's national police used batons and rubber bullets to attack people who were peacefully attempting to cast their vote. Approximately 890 Catalans were injured. Let's make our government stand against brutalising peaceful voters.
attributes.additional_details: The response to a peaceful referendum should never be violence, especially not by the police force that should serve and protect the Catalans. The UK foreign ministry has refused to condemn the Spanish authorities. This is unacceptable to me. I therefore would like to express that I and my fellow citizens do condemn the heinous violence of Spain's national police towards their citizens . Hopefully we will be heard.

attributes.action: Fund Sound Therapy For People With Tourette Syndrome
attributes.background: My name is Jason, im a 20 year old male who suffers from Tourette Syndrome, i have suffered this for many years now and can NOT get the funding to join a sound therapy course
attributes.additional_details: i believe sound therapy would be extremely influential into helping solve the ongoing problem "how do i handle my tics" or "how do i cure my tourettes?" the simple answer is, there is NO cure for Tourette Syndrome, however after research, and being a musician myself, music and drama both seem to reduce the amount i tic, i also underwent a short taster of sound therapy and it reduced my tics sufficiently, i want to help people without tourette understand and people with, to manage it.

attributes.action: Allow police to confiscate mobile phones when drivers are caught using them.
attributes.background: Fining drivers for mobile phone use appears to be of little deterrent on its own. A fine along with points on the license and immediate confiscation could possibly have more impact. The inconvenience and cost of losing all personal contacts and data would, for some people, be immeasurable.
attributes.additional_details: Lincolnshire recently had a blitz on catching drivers using mobile phones, as far as I can see that made absolutely no difference. I see the same people day in day out driving while using hand held mobile phones, that includes tractor drivers.

attributes.action: Commit to a long-term funding plan for health & social care to the year 2035.
attributes.background: We are calling on the government to recognise the rising demand, underfunding and workforce crisis in the NHS and social care sector by committing to a long-term funding plan for health and social care to the year 2035.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is supported by the NHS Confederation.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for security staff to have a body-worn camera.
attributes.background: Due to the nature of some security staff otherwise known as 'bouncers', it has become clear to me that a body worn camera is needed for the safety and security of both parties.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone who has been to an event of some kind knows of one or more stories of something going wrong when trying to get into the event. If evidence such as video can be reviewed then a better outcome can come of the incident.

attributes.action: Make the judgement and discrimination of mental illness unlawful.
attributes.background: 'Neurophobia' describes the judgement and discrimination people show towards mental illness and those suffering with poor mental health. It is only illegal to discriminate against someone if their mental illness affects them enough that it becomes a disability.
attributes.additional_details: It should be illegal to discriminate against people whether or not their illness is a disability. Neurophobia must be recognised as unlawful and unacceptable to allow our society to insist upon equality. Our campaign www.notoneurophobia.com is to raise awareness of Neurophobia. Our aim is to recognise Neurophobia in the same way we recognise racism, homophobia and sexism so that the judgement and discrimination many people with poor mental health face can be eradicated from society.

attributes.action: Debate scrapping the television licence fee and discuss other funding options.
attributes.background: We currently pay £147 per year for a TV licence, the bulk of which goes to the BBC, very little BBC programming these days is of the quality expected, please debate in the Commons with regards scrapping this fee and discuss more viable funding options.

attributes.action: Have GMT all year round.
attributes.background:
An extra hour in bed every day for six months of the year.

The correct time for our longitude.

attributes.action: Urge the FA to withdraw the England team from the World Cup this summer.
attributes.background: The chemical attack on the streets of Salisbury is little short of a declaration of war on Britain's right to offer safe haven to whomsoever it chooses.  Our response must be much bolder than it has so far been.  Putin must not be allowed to use the world cup to normalise his tyranny.
attributes.additional_details: This petition seeks a debate in Parliament whose aim is to persuade the government to urge the FA to withdraw the England Football Team from the World Cup in Russia this summer and to discuss with others who have qualifying teams the possibility of doing the same.

attributes.action: ban homework
attributes.background:
i don't like homework, students don't like homework, teachers don't like homework, so why is homework a thing? we don't need it, so lets get rid of it!
it prevents social building of students, and increases the workload heavily on teachers. homework is bad for everyone, the recipient, and producer.
attributes.additional_details: i hate homework, so let's get rid of it

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.
